intro: Melampyrum nemorosum var. decrescens, commonly known as the lesser touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist woodland habitats and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, with a distinctive stipular structure. It is often found in association with other woodland flora and plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
